data.title: Fernando Pessoa
data.meta_description: Fernando António Nogueira Pessoa was a Portuguese poet, writer, literary critic, translator, and publisher. He has been described as one of the most significant literary figures of the 20th century and one of the greatest poets in the Portuguese language. He also wrote in and translated from English and French.
data.text:
"Alexander Search" redirects here. For the band, see Alexander Search (band).

Fernando António Nogueira Pessoa (Portuguese: [fɨɾˈnɐ̃du pɨˈsoɐ]; 13 June 1888 – 30 November 1935) was a Portuguese poet, writer, literary critic, translator, and publisher. He has been described as one of the most significant literary figures of the 20th century and one of the greatest poets in the Portuguese language. He also wrote in and translated from English and French.

In this Portuguese name, the first or maternal family name is Nogueira and the second or paternal family name is Pessoa.
